Reviews.Title: “Used to be a good business hotel - now in decline”
Reviews.Author: KEH2011
Reviews.Content: On first impressions this is a grand hotel with a very Spanish theme, how it does not take long to realise that the financial downturn may be effecting its standards and facilities. Staff are friendly, hotel is clean and a pleasant environment, how ever the following has been questionable: - although rooms have TV channels stating what programs both Spanish and International are available – only Spanish programs are available. - some rooms showing signs of wear and tear with certain bits missing i.e. switches, baths/showers discoloured, curtains – some work some do not. - room service is limited in choice - breakfast looks impressive but no labels explaining what all the food is, hot plate not very appetising, milk warm, coffee questionable, if busy tables show signs of previous use and can be slow to clear tables - restaurant – very limited and expensive, not always attended - internet coverage is hit and miss In summary – this hotel although grand in initial appearance, seems to of had its day and is on a decline with regards to quality, lacks attention to detail and service.

Reviews.Title: “Average but ok”
Reviews.Author: Alvarorrr
Reviews.Content: There are three reasons why I regularly stay in this hotel when I'm in Madrid: (i) It is next to my parents place (but for visitors that want to visit the center is not very convinient): (ii) rooms are very large; (iii) it has a nice gymn/spa; (iv) during weekends it has reasonable prices (70-80 EUR). Reception staff is average, the Argentinean doorman is rude and incompetent and even if the hotel is new some of the rooms look old.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely business hotel”
Reviews.Author: CamsPig
Reviews.Content: My favourite business hotel in Europe. It helps that it is so close to my Company's office but the rooms are absolutely fantastic which makes up for the fact that it is a little out of the centre of things

Reviews.Title: “At last, a decent business stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDR-1
Reviews.Content: Excellent value at E99 considering what you get; a very large, exec furnished, comfortable room. Staff v friendly, would most certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyW
Reviews.Content: Located slightly to the North of the City. 10 minute walk East of Charmartin Station. Luxury hotel with all mod-cons. Great gym and swimming pool (roof comes off during the days), sauna, steam room complex too. Great breakfast. Massive rooms, fancy bathroom as you would expect. Would definately recommend. The only disadvantage is its location, not great if you want the city centre. However, there are many resturants within 15 minute walk. Only 10 minutes taxi from the Airport as well.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST luxury value in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveller to Madrid, I have stayed at most of the 4 and 5 star hotels. This is by far the best one I have stayed in. It is a little far from the tourist centers (15 min taxi), but it is well worth it. The rooms are huge and luxurious. DON'T stay here if you like modern or minimalist, but otherwise, you will love the replica antique furniture in this brand new building. The staff is curteous and professional and the prices are excellent. Great food and a full health club used by locals as well. I'm not easily fooled by "luxury" hotels - read my reviews on the Wellington (not up to 5* standards) and the Palace (nice, but waaay overpriced).
